column1: Hard-bodied and soft-bodied female ticks are believed to make a poison that can cause paralysis in children.
Children with tick paralysis develop an unsteady gait followed several days later by weakness in the lower legs.
The child may also have mild, flu-like symptoms (muscle aches, tiredness).
For example, they may have gone on a camping trip, live in a tick-infested area, or have dogs or other animals that can pick up ticks.
